wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Charles Brown (May 22, 1912 – December 19, 2004) was an American chemist and recipient of the 1979 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his work with organoboranes.

response: *2004 – Herbert C. Brown, English-American chemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1912)
*1912 – Herbert C. Brown, English-American chemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 2004)

Two faculty members (chemists Herbert C. Brown and Ei-ichi Negishi) have been awarded Nobel Prizes while at Purdue. In all, 13 Nobel Prizes in five fields have been associated with Purdue including students, researchers, and current and previous faculty."Purdue University Nobel Prizes" . Purdue University. Retrieved 2013-03-02. Other notable faculty of the past have included Golden Gate Bridge designer Charles Alton Ellis, efficiency expert Lillian Gilbreth, food safety advocate Harvey Wiley, aviator Amelia Earhart, president of the National Association of Mathematicians Edray Goins, radio pioneer Reginald Fessenden, and Yeram S. Touloukian, founder of the Thermophysical Properties Research Center.
* May 22 – Herbert C. Brown, English-born chemist, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 2004)
* Chemistry – Herbert C. Brown, Georg Wittig
** Herbert C. Brown, English-born American chemist and Nobel laureate (b. 1912)
